attributes.action: Reconsider the nips for the a20 sidcup bypass crittals corner
attributes.additional_details:
Unfortunately London transport went ahead and turned on the cameras prior to any consultation and knew that there was inadequate signage etc.
TfL had also said that they would not be issuing any fines until the signage had been improved.
None of this has happened and fines have been given. Many people are at risk of losing jobs etc in this cost of living crisis that we already have.we ask parliament to re look at this and do the right thing in not issuing the fines and points.
attributes.background: We would like you to reconsider the fines and penalties given for speeding on the a20 sidcup bypass. Inadequately signed and a 50mph sign still present between the new 40mph that have gone up since people have complained. Many people in the same situation and at risk of losing jobs etc

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local roads are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
